org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.phd

Interface Phd

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Trace

    public interface Phd
extends Trace
    Phd is an object representation of a single read from a phd file or a phd.ball file.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Map<String,String> getComments()
      Get the optional comments associated with this phd.
      PositionSequence getPeakSequence()
      Get the optional PositionSequence representing the sanger peaks for this Phd.
      List<PhdReadTag> getReadTags()
      Get the optional whole read tags associated with this phd that are contained in the phd file.
      List<PhdWholeReadItem> getWholeReadItems()
      Get the optional whole read items associated with this phd that are contained in the phd file.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jcvi.jillion.trace.Trace

        getId, getLength, getNucleotideSequence, getQualitySequence

    • Method Detail

      • getComments

        Map<String,String> getComments()
        Get the optional comments associated with this phd.
        Returns:
        a Map where the keys and values are both Strings; if this phd does not contain any comments, then this method returns an empty map. Will never return null.

      • getWholeReadItems

        List<PhdWholeReadItem> getWholeReadItems()
        Get the optional whole read items associated with this phd that are contained in the phd file.
        Returns:
        a List of PhdWholeReadItems if this phd does not contain any whole read items, then this method returns an empty list. Will never return null.

      • getReadTags

        List<PhdReadTag> getReadTags()
        Get the optional whole read tags associated with this phd that are contained in the phd file.
        Returns:
        a List of PhdReadTags if this phd does not contain any whole read items, then this method returns an empty list. Will never return null.

      • getPeakSequence

        PositionSequence getPeakSequence()
        Get the optional PositionSequence representing the sanger peaks for this Phd. Recent versions of consed allow the peak sequence to be optional if the sequence technology does not support it (previous versions of consed forced the positions to be faked). For example, solexa sequences do not have peaks, however sanger chromatograms do.
        Returns:
        the PositionSequence for this phd if there is one; or null if no peak sequence exists for this trace.
